Text: Gas Management Agreementis the red lined draft of the Gas management Agreement with the changes we discussed Please review and give me your comments If you can supply any of the needed Notice info in Section please let me know

Tenaska Gas management Agreement Cc Just following up on my email and call last week re the CPI informationjust as soon as you can get that to me I will be able to get out a revised draft i know folks are anxious so let me know if there is someone else you would like me to ask about this Thanks for your help Sandi Forwarded by Sandi M BrabandHOUECT on AM Sandi M Braband PM To Daren J CT cc Subject Tenaska Gas management Agreement Daren Can you get me the specifics on the Consumer Price Index as you all would like to see it referenced in the agreement Is there a specific publication that I can reference like I do for HSC proces in the first of the month Inside FERC let me know

Tenaska Gas management AgreementCan you get me the specifics on the Consumer Price Index as you all would like to see it referenced in the agreement Is there a specific publication that I can reference like I do for HSC proces in the first of the month Inside FERC let me know

Re Cornhusker Cc I have a draft that I have been working on revisinggot pulled off to work on Triple Lutz again and may not have anything to distribute until late next weekI will be out of the office on Triple Lutz the rest of today and tomorrow and then out of town until the thI will try to get something to you to look at before I go but can make no guarantees Sandi John NRON AM To Sandi M CT cc Subject Cornhusker Sandi What is going on with Cornhusker Have we made any progress on the agreement Please let me know where we stand Thanks John

Re Rate for Tenaska DealSorry Daren J Farmer PM To Sandi M CT cc Subject Re Rate for Tenaska Deal Consumer Price Index From Sandi M Braband on PM To Daren J CT cc Subject Re Rate for Tenaska Deal Daren Thankswhile Im certain I should know I must confess that i do not know what CPI stands for Sandi Daren J Farmer AM To Sandi M CT Bob M nron cc Subject Re Rate for Tenaska Deal Sandi Sorry for just now getting back with you I was out last week The rate mmbtu will be charged on the greater of the volumes nominated on the supply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant The fee will be adjusted yearly based on CPI Bob I could not remember if we stated the type of settlement on the delivered volumes actuals or nominations I think we should use actuals due to possibility that the plant could over pull with out our knowledge on a daily basis We would receive the estimatesactuals on a lag and may have to purchase gas to offset the imbalance even though the plant kept the noms at the base I also think that if the plant does increase the nom they are more likely to pull the additional volume rather than pulling less Do you agree with this D From Sandi M Braband on PM To Daren J CT cc Subject Rate for Tenaska Deal Daren When we met regarding the rate for the Tenaska Gas Management Agreement you guys mentioned that it would be tied to an indexcould you restate for me how that is to workit will start out cents per MMBTU based on the greater of the volumes nominated through the supply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant Then the fee will vary month to month year to year based on what index Thanks Sandi

Re Rate for Tenaska DealThankswhile Im certain I should know I must confess that i do not know what CPI stands for Sandi Daren J Farmer AM To Sandi M CT Bob M nron cc Subject Re Rate for Tenaska Deal Sandi Sorry for just now getting back with you I was out last week The rate mmbtu will be charged on the greater of the volumes nominated on the supply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant The fee will be adjusted yearly based on CPI Bob I could not remember if we stated the type of settlement on the delivered volumes actuals or nominations I think we should use actuals due to possibility that the plant could over pull with out our knowledge on a daily basis We would receive the estimatesactuals on a lag and may have to purchase gas to offset the imbalance even though the plant kept the noms at the base I also think that if the plant does increase the nom they are more likely to pull the additional volume rather than pulling less Do you agree with this D From Sandi M Braband on PM To Daren J CT cc Subject Rate for Tenaska Deal Daren When we met regarding the rate for the Tenaska Gas Management Agreement you guys mentioned that it would be tied to an indexcould you restate for me how that is to workit will start out cents per MMBTU based on the greater of the volumes nominated through the supply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant Then the fee will vary month to month year to year based on what index Thanks Sandi

Gas Management AgreementWill there ever be a need to utilize transport to get supply to the plant other than through the Lone Star agreements If so would we be using Tenaska transport agreements or ENA

Rate for Tenaska DealWhen we met regarding the rate for the Tenaska Gas Management Agreement you guys mentioned that it would be tied to an indexcould you restate for me how that is to workit will start out cents per MMBTU based on the greater of the volumes nominated through the supply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant Then the fee will vary month to month year to year based on what index Thanks Sandi

Re Cornhuskermeant to copy you guys on this Forwarded by Sandi M BrabandHOUECT on PM Sandi M Braband AM To Garrick CT cc Dan CT Subject Re Cornhusker Rick Bob Hall Daren Farmer and I met on Thursday regarding the feeI have a very rough draft done and my plan is to revise and edit today and tomorrow However I spoke with Dan Lyons yesterday regarding some issues with the supply contracts that concerned me and he agrees that we need to look into them further In addition Bob Hall Daren and I thought we might could use a brief tutorial on the structure of the transaction generally the parties involved and their correct legal names and their relationship to Enron Dan Lyons has volunteered to give us that tutorial but will not be available until early next week when he and I will meet to discuss the supply contract issues as well Call me if you have any questions Sandi ext Garrick Hill AM To Sandi M CT Daren J CT John nron cc Charles NRON John CT Mike nron Subject Cornhusker Where are we on the gas agreement for the Cleburne plant

Tenaska IV Cc Attached are drafts of the letters notifiying Williams Apache and Lone Star that ENA will be acting as agent for Tenaska IV Please review the letters and get back to me on the following items Person to send the letters to at the respective companies Fax s to fax it to on Friday Name and adress of ENA person to direct inquiries to Name and phone number of person to direct questions re the notification letter People at Tenaska to copy and their address and fax s Comments on substance of the letter please review carefully my reference to what ENA is acting as agent forit is specific as to noms scheduling and billing not a general agency for all things under the contractis that correct If you dont mind please forward any email response to Bob Walker and leave me a voicemail I will be out of the office Friday but checking voicemail and coordianting with Bob to get these out Also once we send these letters out we should be prepared for each of these entities to ask to see the agency agreement They may in fact not be comfortable dealing with ENA with just this letter

Re Rate for Tenaska DealSorry Daren J Farmer PM To Sandi M CT cc Subject Re Rate for Tenaska Deal Consumer Price Index From Sandi M Braband on PM To Daren J CT cc Subject Re Rate for Tenaska Deal Daren Thankswhile Im certain I should know I must confess that i do not know what CPI stands for Sandi Daren J Farmer AM To Sandi M CT Bob M nron cc Subject Re Rate for Tenaska Deal Sandi Sorry for just now getting back with you I was out last week The rate mmbtu will be charged on the greater of the volumes nominated on the supply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant The fee will be adjusted yearly based on CPI Bob I could not remember if we stated the type of settlement on the delivered volumes actuals or nominations I think we should use actuals due to possibility that the plant could over pull with out our knowledge on a daily basis We would receive the estimatesactuals on a lag and may have to purchase gas to offset the imbalance even though the plant kept the noms at the base I also think that if the plant does increase the nom they are more likely to pull the additional volume rather than pulling less Do you agree with this D From Sandi M Braband on PM To Daren J CT cc Subject Rate for Tenaska Deal Daren When we met regarding the rate for the Tenaska Gas Management Agreement you guys mentioned that it would be tied to an indexcould you restate for me how that is to workit will start out cents per MMBTU based on the greater of the volumes nominated through the supply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant Then the fee will vary month to month year to year based on what index Thanks Sandi

Re Cornhuskermeant to copy you guys on this Forwarded by Sandi M BrabandHOUECT on PM Sandi M Braband AM To Garrick CT cc Dan CT Subject Re Cornhusker Rick Bob Hall Daren Farmer and I met on Thursday regarding the feeI have a very rough draft done and my plan is to revise and edit today and tomorrow However I spoke with Dan Lyons yesterday regarding some issues with the supply contracts that concerned me and he agrees that we need to look into them further In addition Bob Hall Daren and I thought we might could use a brief tutorial on the structure of the transaction generally the parties involved and their correct legal names and their relationship to Enron Dan Lyons has volunteered to give us that tutorial but will not be available until early next week when he and I will meet to discuss the supply contract issues as well Call me if you have any questions Sandi ext Garrick Hill AM To Sandi M CT Daren J CT John nron cc Charles NRON John CT Mike nron Subject Cornhusker Where are we on the gas agreement for the Cleburne plant

Tenaska IV Cc Attached are drafts of the letters notifiying Williams Apache and Lone Star that ENA will be acting as agent for Tenaska IV Please review the letters and get back to me on the following items Person to send the letters to at the respective companies Fax s to fax it to on Friday Name and adress of ENA person to direct inquiries to Name and phone number of person to direct questions re the notification letter People at Tenaska to copy and their address and fax s Comments on substance of the letter please review carefully my reference to what ENA is acting as agent forit is specific as to noms scheduling and billing not a general agency for all things under the contractis that correct If you dont mind please forward any email response to Bob Walker and leave me a voicemail I will be out of the office Friday but checking voicemail and coordianting with Bob to get these out Also once we send these letters out we should be prepared for each of these entities to ask to see the agency agreement They may in fact not be comfortable dealing with ENA with just this letter

Tenaska agreementpst Darren do you know what the situation is with getting that Tenaska agreement signed it is on a list to be assigned to HPL in the sale and I dont think it has ever been executedI know you left me a message a week or so ago about thisis there any information that i owe you

Tenaskapst Darren Attached is the last draft of the agreement I distributed months ago with no responselet me know what the hold up is if you knowI corresponded originally with Rick Hill but never heard is he still involved Sandi

Re Tenaska AgreementI have not heard from Rick on this draft Did he send it to you I had forwarded the initial draft to you but we had a meeting and made some changes that resulted in this most recent draft I forwarded it to Rick Hill and Darren Farmer for comments and have received noneCopied Rick on my earlier email to you to serve as a remeinfer to him Did you have any comments John NRON PM To Sandi M CT cc Subject Re Tenaska Agreement I have seen this Where do we stand with this draft Are we close to coming up with a final Who are we waiting on Please let me know Thanks John

Re Tenaska Agreement Cc I forwarded the attached draft of the agreement a month or so back for comments I apologize for failing to copy youattached is the draft Please forward any comments to me Thanks Sandi John NRON PM To Sandi M CT cc Subject Tenaska Agreement Sandy How are things going I just wanted to get an update on the agency agreement for the Tenaska plant Thanks John Griffith

Re Tenaska Agreement Cc I forwarded the attached draft of the agreement a month or so back for comments I apologize for failing to copy youattached is the draft Please forward any comments to me Thanks Sandi John NRON PM To Sandi M CT cc Subject Tenaska Agreement Sandy How are things going I just wanted to get an update on the agency agreement for the Tenaska plant Thanks John Griffith

ENA Contracts Going to AEP Cc the list of ENA contracts to be assigned to HPL or LODISCO which George forwarded to me this afternoon He intends that this is substantially all of such contracts but is continuing the review process and may have a few more to add Please review this list and let me know if you see any problems with assigning these As I mentioned previously I will prepare the docs just need to determine which contracts to scheduleCall me if you have any questions Forwarded by Sandi M BrabandHOUECT on PM George Weissman PM To Sandi M CT cc Robert CT Subject ENA Contracts Going to AEP

Assignment to LODISCO Cc Attached is a draft of the assignemnt from ENA to LODISCOplease take a look at the exhibit and confirm for me that the contracts listed are all the contracts which should go Note that I have taken off the Empire contract as you requested as well as one of the Southern Union agreementsI have also added the additional TXU fuel agreement and Entex Gas Resources agreementas you requested If you could please get me the new Global number for the Entex Gas Resources contract this assignment should be in good shapelet me know

New deals on HPL Cc Dan Do either of you have documentation on this deal Niether Shawna nor myself have any knowledge of it and as you can see Patrick would like to include it in the data roomlet me know please Thanks Sandi Forwarded by Sandi M BrabandHOUECT on PM Patrick Wade PM To Edward D CT Kenneth W CT Sandi M CT Robert CT cc Subject New deals on HPL We need to include this deal in our data roomcontract list Forwarded by Patrick WadeHOUECT on PM From Jim Coffey AM To Patrick CT Brian CT cc Subject New deals on HPL Forwarded by Jim CoffeyHOUECT on AM Enron Capital Management From David Baumbach AM To Jim CT cc Wes CT Thomas A CT Jim CT Subject New deals on HPL On Friday Nov we had a new long term deal entered under HPL It was a wellhead deal with Conoco at four different meters It was priced at of HSC index The value on the deal was Logically this would increase our recoverable cost from mil to mil I will send you notes periodically on new long term deals that increase our unwind costs Dave

New deals on HPL Cc Dan Do either of you have documentation on this deal Niether Shawna nor myself have any knowledge of it and as you can see Patrick would like to include it in the data roomlet me know please Thanks Sandi Forwarded by Sandi M BrabandHOUECT on PM Patrick Wade PM To Edward D CT Kenneth W CT Sandi M CT Robert CT cc Subject New deals on HPL We need to include this deal in our data roomcontract list Forwarded by Patrick WadeHOUECT on PM From Jim Coffey AM To Patrick CT Brian CT cc Subject New deals on HPL Forwarded by Jim CoffeyHOUECT on AM Enron Capital Management From David Baumbach AM To Jim CT cc Wes CT Thomas A CT Jim CT Subject New deals on HPL On Friday Nov we had a new long term deal entered under HPL It was a wellhead deal with Conoco at four different meters It was priced at of HSC index The value on the deal was Logically this would increase our recoverable cost from mil to mil I will send you notes periodically on new long term deals that increase our unwind costs Dave

Assignment to LODISCO Cc Attached is a draft of the assignemnt from ENA to LODISCOplease take a look at the exhibit and confirm for me that the contracts listed are all the contracts which should go Note that I have taken off the Empire contract as you requested as well as one of the Southern Union agreementsI have also added the additional TXU fuel agreement and Entex Gas Resources agreementas you requested If you could please get me the new Global number for the Entex Gas Resources contract this assignment should be in good shapelet me know

Houston Pipe Line Cc Apst Attached are the disclosure schedules to the Purchase and Sale Agreement with AEP I have also attached the portion of the PSA that contains the reps and warranties to which the schedules relate Please review the following schedules against the reps and warranties to which they relate and let me know if any changes or updates need to be made This is necessary to comply with responsibilities to update these schedules prior to Closing I would appreciate your response by Friday morning If you have any questions please call me at ext Thank you Sandi Braband Senior Counsel

Transport Agreement with Destin Pipeline Cc I received the abovereferenced agreement from you this morning and will be out of pocket the next several days on another HPL matter I am forwarding it to Gerald who handles most of the transport agreements for us and I believe he will be back in the office on Wed afternoon You indicated there is some urgency so call me if a couple of days for turnaround is a problem FYII have still not heard back from Lynn Johnson re my questions on the Garden Banks and Destin interactive website agreements she had left me a message telling me she had not forgotten about me but was waiting on someone else to respond to her Let me know if that gets criticalIll keep you posted Sandi
